termsPage.title: AI Ehon Maker Terms of Service

0.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Application)
0.content:
These Terms of Service (hereinafter referred to as “these Terms”) apply to all users (hereinafter referred to as “Users”) of the web application “AI Ehon Maker” (hereinafter referred to as “the Service”) operated by our company (hereinafter referred to as “the Company”). Users must agree to these Terms before using the Service.

1. These Terms set forth the conditions for providing the Service and the rights and obligations between the Company and the Users regarding the use of the Service.
2. Guidelines, policies, precautions, etc. (hereinafter referred to as “Individual Provisions”) separately presented by the Company constitute a part of these Terms, and in the event of any conflict with these Terms, the Individual Provisions shall take precedence.
3. Users who do not agree to these Terms cannot use the Service.

1.heading: Article 2 (Definitions)
1.content:
The meanings of the terms used in these Terms are as follows:

1. “the Service”: The web application “AI Ehon Maker” provided by the Company, consisting of features such as AI-based picture book auto-generation, a credit-based payment system, a community feature, etc.
2. “User”: Any individual or corporation that views or uses the Service.
3. “Logged-in User”: A User who has registered an account via the Company’s designated procedure and is logged in using an email address and password or OAuth authentication.
4. “Credits”: A prepaid virtual currency that can be used within the Service for page generation and other features. Users can purchase Credits through payment methods such as Stripe.

2.heading: Article 3 (Account Registration and Management)
2.content:
1. Registration Procedure
   Users shall complete the account registration by entering required information such as email address and password in accordance with the procedures designated by the Company. The Company may refuse the registration if the applicant has previously had their account suspended for violating these Terms or for other reasons.

2. Use by Minors
   If a minor uses the Service, they must obtain prior consent from their legal guardian (such as a parent). The Company may refuse use if it cannot confirm such consent.

3. Account Management
   Users shall manage their login information (email address, password, etc.) under their own responsibility and shall not transfer, lend, or allow any third party to use it. Unless there is intent or gross negligence on the part of the Company, the Company shall not be liable for any damages resulting from unauthorized use by a third party.

4. Change or Deletion of Account
   Users may change their registered information or withdraw (delete their account) in accordance with the procedures designated by the Company. The handling of remaining Credits upon withdrawal is subject to Article 7.

3.heading: Article 4 (Credits and Fees)
3.content:
1. Purchase of Credits
   Users may purchase Credits by paying the prescribed amount via Stripe or other payment methods on the purchase screen within the Service (for example, 1000 Credits for $10). Once the purchase is completed, the Credits are immediately reflected in the User’s account.

2. Use and Consumption of Credits
   When a User uses the picture book page generation feature, 20 Credits are consumed per page. This likewise applies to regeneration or additional pages; if there are not enough Credits, generation cannot proceed, and an additional purchase is required.

3. Credit Validity and Refunds
   Credits generally have no expiration date, and no refund is provided for unused Credits when withdrawing or deleting an account (except as otherwise provided by law).

4. Credit History Inquiry
   Users can check their Credit balance, purchase history, and consumption history within the Service.

4.heading: Article 5 (Picture Book Generation Feature)
4.content:
1. Generation Process
   Based on the page count and theme specified by the User, text such as the title and body is generated by a large language model (like GPT), followed by image generation using Stable AI. The User can preview the results and regenerate if necessary, but each regeneration consumes additional Credits.

2. Quality and Consistency of Generated Content
   The accuracy, usefulness, and consistency of outputs from AI models are not guaranteed. Misinformation or inappropriate expressions may appear, so Users use them at their own risk, performing regeneration and corrections as needed.

3. Storage and Editing
   The generated picture book can be freely saved by the User, and can still be regenerated or edited after saving. However, each regeneration consumes Credits.

5.heading: Article 6 (Community Feature)
5.content:
1. Publishing Settings
   Users can post the generated picture book to the community by selecting “Public,” “Limited,” or “Private.” For “Limited,” only those who know the URL can view it.

2. Viewing and Reactions
   Guest users can only view the cover and title, while logged-in users (subject to conditions set by the Company) can view all pages, leave comments, and use “like” features.

3. Prohibited Content
   Posts that violate public order and morals, infringe on the rights of third parties, constitute defamation, discrimination, violence, obscene expressions, or other content the Company deems inappropriate are prohibited.

4. Measures for Violations
   The Company may delete relevant works or take other actions such as account suspension without prior notice if any post violates these Terms or applicable laws.

6.heading: Article 7 (Account Suspension and Treatment upon Withdrawal)
6.content:
1. Account Suspension
   If a User violates these Terms or applicable laws, the Company may suspend or delete the User’s account without prior notice.

2. Credits upon Withdrawal
   Even if the User voluntarily withdraws, any unused Credits will be forfeited upon account deletion, and no refund will be provided.

3. Handling of Stored Data
   Upon withdrawal, picture books and community posts saved by the User may be deleted, and if they have already been referenced or downloaded by other users, complete deletion is not guaranteed.

7.heading: Article 8 (User Responsibility and Self-Burden)
7.content:
1. The User shall act at their own responsibility and expense when using the Service. In the event of a dispute with another user or a third party, the User shall resolve the dispute at their own responsibility and expense.
2. The copyright and legal responsibilities for picture books, comments, etc. created or posted by the User shall belong to the User.

8.heading: Article 9 (Prohibited Acts)
8.content:
Users shall not engage in the following acts when using the Service:

1. Acts that violate laws or public order and morals
2. Acts that infringe on the intellectual property rights, portrait rights, privacy rights, or honor of the Company or any third party
3. Registering, posting, or transmitting false or misleading information
4. Overloading the server, unauthorized access, or reverse engineering
5. Sending discriminatory, violent, obscene information, child pornography, or other content that violates public order and morals
6. Any other act that the Company deems inappropriate

9.heading: Article 10 (Intellectual Property Rights and Ownership of Rights)
9.content:
1. Rights of the Company
   All intellectual property rights in and to the Service (including programs, trademarks, logos, images, designs, etc.) belong to the Company or rightful rights holders. Users shall not use (including reproduction, modification, distribution, etc.) any of these without the permission of the Company.

2. Rights to User-Generated Content (Picture Books, etc.)
   In principle, the copyright of text and images generated by the User (hereinafter referred to as “Generated Content”) belongs to the User. However, for promotional and other necessary purposes, the Company reserves a non-exclusive, royalty-free right to use such Generated Content. Users shall ensure that no rights of third parties are infringed, and if a dispute arises, they shall handle it at their own responsibility.

10.heading: Article 11 (Disclaimer)
10.content:
1. The Company makes no warranty whatsoever regarding the accuracy, usefulness, or fitness for a particular purpose of the output from the Service (including text generation by AI and image generation by Stable AI).
2. The Company shall not be liable for damages (including indirect damages and lost profits) arising from the use or inability to use the Service unless there is intent or gross negligence on the part of the Company.
3. The Company shall not be involved in nor bear any responsibility for disputes between Users or between Users and third parties.

11.heading: Article 12 (Changes, Suspension, or Termination of the Service)
11.content:
1. The Company may, with prior notice, change, add, or terminate the contents of the Service.
2. The Service may be temporarily suspended due to system maintenance, emergency response, natural disasters, legal requirements, etc. The Company shall not be liable for any damages resulting from such suspension.

12.heading: Article 13 (Handling of Personal Information)
12.content: The Company shall appropriately handle the personal information of Users in accordance with the separately established Privacy Policy. By using the Service, Users are deemed to have agreed to the Privacy Policy.

13.heading: Article 14 (Modification of these Terms)
13.content:
1. The Company may change these Terms at any time.
2. When changing these Terms, the Company will give notice on the Service or on the Company’s website at least seven days before the effective date.
3. If the User continues to use the Service after the changes come into effect, the User is deemed to have agreed to the changes.

14.heading: Article 15 (Governing Law and Jurisdiction)
14.content:
1. These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Japan.
2. In the event of a dispute arising in connection with the Service or these Terms, the exclusive agreed jurisdiction shall be the Japanese court having jurisdiction over the location of the Company.

15.heading: Article 16 (Severability)
15.content:
1. Even if any provision or part of these Terms is deemed invalid or unenforceable under applicable law, the remaining provisions of these Terms shall remain in full force and effect.
2. If there is any question or dispute regarding these Terms between the Company and the User, both parties shall work in good faith to resolve it amicably through discussion.

0.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Application)
0.content: This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as “this Policy”) sets forth the policies for handling personal information and equivalent information (hereinafter collectively referred to as “Personal Information, etc.”) collected or used in connection with the web application “AI Ehon Maker” (hereinafter referred to as “the Service”) operated by our company (hereinafter referred to as “the Company”). All users (hereinafter referred to as “Users”) of the Service shall be deemed to have agreed to this Policy.

1.heading: Article 2 (Information Collected)
1.content:
In providing the Service, the Company may collect the following information:

1. Registration Information: Email address, password, user name, profile image, etc. entered/provided by the User during account registration or profile setup
2. Information on Generated Content: Titles, text, and image data of picture books created by AI, as well as feedback provided when regenerating content
3. Payment Information: Credit card numbers, payment methods, purchase history, etc. (including information handled on services such as Stripe)
4. Log Information: Access dates, IP addresses, browser type, device information, referrer URLs, and other access logs
5. Information Automatically Obtained Through Cookies or Similar Technologies: User usage status, session information, etc.
6. Inquiry/Support Information: Email addresses, inquiry contents, attached files, etc. that Users send via inquiry forms

2.heading: Article 3 (Purpose of Use)
2.content:
The Company uses the collected Personal Information, etc. for the following purposes:

1. To provide and operate the Service
2. To respond to inquiries from Users and provide account support
3. For the development, improvement, and stable provision of AI-based picture book generation features
4. To manage credits purchased or used, and to process payments
5. To investigate and address violations and maintain a safe and sound service environment
6. To analyze User usage and access trends for functional improvements and new service development
7. To send maintenance information or important notices necessary for service operations
8. To create and publish statistical data processed in a format that does not identify individuals
9. For other purposes separately notified to Users in advance

3.heading: Article 4 (Cookies and Tracking Technologies)
3.content:
1. The Company may use cookies, web beacons, or similar technologies to make the Service more convenient for Users, and to optimize advertisement distribution and analyze usage.
2. Users may reject or delete cookies through their browser settings, but this may result in some features of the Service becoming unavailable.
3. The Company may use third-party analytics services (e.g., Google Analytics) to collect and analyze site visit status or usage trends. The handling of data collected by such analytic services is subject to each service provider’s privacy policy.

4.heading: Article 5 (Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties)
4.content:
1. The Company will not provide Personal Information, etc. to third parties without the User’s consent, except in the following cases:
   (1) When required by law
   (2) When necessary to protect the life, body, or property of a person and it is difficult to obtain the User’s consent
   (3) When particularly necessary to improve public health or promote the sound growth of children and it is difficult to obtain the User’s consent
   (4) When it is necessary to cooperate with a national or local government agency or a party entrusted by such in performing legal duties, and obtaining the User’s consent might interfere with the performance of those duties
   (5) When the Company provides such information within the scope necessary to third-party external services (cloud servers, payment services, email distribution services, etc.) to which the Company outsources operations
2. Notwithstanding the preceding paragraph, if the Company does provide information to third parties, the Company will enter into confidentiality agreements with such third parties and take steps to ensure appropriate protection of the User’s Personal Information, etc.

5.heading: Article 6 (Security Measures)
5.content:
1. The Company implements appropriate security measures to prevent leakage, loss, or damage of Personal Information, etc.
2. The Company concludes confidentiality agreements with employees and contractors who handle Personal Information, etc., and supervises them to prevent unauthorized access, loss, destruction, or tampering.
3. In the event of a leak or other serious incident involving Personal Information, the Company will promptly investigate the facts, report and notify the relevant parties and authorities, and take measures to prevent recurrence.

6.heading: Article 7 (User Rights)
6.content:
1. Users may request disclosure, correction, suspension of use, deletion, etc. of their Personal Information, etc. through procedures designated by the Company.
2. If the User is a minor, the legal guardian (such as a parent) may exercise the same rights, depending on applicable laws.
3. The Company may conduct identity verification procedures when responding to requests for disclosure, etc.

7.heading: Article 8 (Protection of Children’s Privacy)
7.content:
1. The Company pays special attention to the protection of minors’ Personal Information, especially children under 13 years of age, and may verify parental consent as necessary.
2. If parents or guardians have concerns regarding the provision of Personal Information by minors, please contact the Inquiry Desk listed at the end of this Policy.

8.heading: Article 9 (International Data Transfer)
8.content: Because the Company uses cloud services, etc., Personal Information, etc. may be transferred and stored in countries outside the User’s country of residence. These countries may have different data protection laws than Japan, but the Company will take appropriate protective measures and protect the User’s Personal Information, etc. in accordance with this Policy.

9.heading: Article 10 (Retention Period)
9.content: The Company retains Personal Information, etc. only as long as it is necessary to fulfill the purpose of use. After the purpose of use has been achieved, or upon the expiration of the storage period required by law or business necessity, the Company will delete or dispose of the information by appropriate methods.

10.heading: Article 11 (Changes to this Privacy Policy)
10.content:
1. The Company may change this Policy at any time.
2. The changes will be announced on the Service or on the Company’s website, and will become effective on the date specified in the announcement or on the effective date determined by the Company.
3. If the User continues to use the Service after the changes become effective, the User is deemed to have agreed to the changes.

11.heading: Article 12 (Contact Information)
11.content:
For any questions regarding this Policy or requests for disclosure, correction, or deletion of Personal Information, etc., please contact the following:

[Contact Information]
Service Name: AI Ehon Maker
Email: aiehonmaker.japan@gmail.com
Other contact methods: Inquiry Form URL, etc.

Upon receiving such requests, the Company will take appropriate and prompt action after confirming the identity of the requester.
